results.title: Sunshine North Technical School
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”
Examines new techniques and attitudes toward the total library services in a co-educational technical school in Victoria (Sunshine North Technical School) with a large migrant student population.

results.title: Sacred Heart College for boys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”.
Examines new techniques and attitudes towards the total library services in a Catholic boarding school for boys. Emphasises centralised resources, individualised study and production of new teaching aids. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Woodbridge District School (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Timothy Read, Chris Noonan and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place Where Books Are Kept”.
This film shows a media-mobile van visiting a school. The crew on the van is shown instructing the staff of the school in a range of audio-visual activities. Some examples of software are shown and various suggestions are given as to their use within the curricula. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Timothy Read, Chris Noonan and Film Australia

results.title: Summer City
results.creator_credit: Christopher Fraser, Phil Avalon and Summer City Productions
results.brief_description: Set in the early 1960’s, four young men take off for a weekend fling in search of girls, surf, and thrills, but encounter fear and death. Stars Mel Gibson, Steve Bisley, John Jarratt and Abigail.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christopher Fraser, Phil Avalon and Summer City Productions

results.title: Sultans of swing: the very best of Dire Straits
results.creator_credit: Marghie Evans and PolyGram Video International
results.brief_description: ‘Sultans of swing’ features 16 of Dire Strait’s most popular songs including: “Sultans of swing”, “Lady writer”, “Romeo and Juliet”, “Tunnel of love”, “Private investigations”, “Twisting by the pool”, “Love over gold (live)”, “So far away”, “Money for nothing”, “Brothers in arms”, “Walk of life”, “Calling Elvis”, “Heavy fuel”, “On every street”, “Your latest trick (live)” and “Local hero - wild theme (live)”.

results.title: Suivez-Moi Jeune Homme! = Follow Me Young Man!
results.creator_credit: Guy Le Franc, Marcel Lathiere and Paul Cadeac
results.brief_description:
Oranos, a wealthy greek business man, is in love with Francoise, a jewellery shop attendant, who consistantly rebuffs him. Suspecting she may already have a boyfriend, he is having her followed by Michel, a private detective, who promptly falls in love with her.

Credits: Producer, Paul Cadeac, Marcel Lathiere ; director, Guy Le Franc ; writers, Roland Moronval, Jean Halain ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Louiguy.
Cast: Dany Robin, Daniel Gelin, Lona Rita, Jacques Jouanneau, Noel Roquevert, Georges Chamarat, Michel Galabru, Fernand Sardoux.

results.title: Sugar Slaves
results.creator_credit: Jean Jacques Portail, Trevor Graham, Penny Robins, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Arcadia Films, Annamax Media and Film Australia
results.brief_description: In 1994 Australia took over Cuba to become the largest exporter of raw sugar in the world. Ironically in that same year, Australian Islanders descendants from the South Pacific Islanders who were kidnapped and enticed by white slave-traders and transported to Queensland to work the Queensland sugar plantations over one hundred years ago, finally won official recognition as a distinct ethnic community - the only substantial black migrant group in Australia. This documentary film tells of the hardships, the appalling working conditions and the exploitation which took place in Queensland between 1863 and 1904 of about 60,000 “Kanakas”, mainly men, but some women, slave labourers from the South Pacific Islands, including Vanuatu and the Solomon Islands. It follows several Australian Islander descendants as they try to retrace the history of their long-lost relatives and combines their personal stories with archival footage, stills, newsreels and quotes from newspaper articles of the time. Many Australians are unaware of our not so proud past dealings in human trafficking and slave labour and the term “blackbirding” (white slave-traders’ term for sailing in and stealing the Islanders) and so “Sugar slaves” for that very reason makes compelling viewing. Contains some b&w sequences. Narrated by Jonathan Holmes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Jacques Portail, Trevor Graham, Penny Robins, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Arcadia Films, Annamax Media and Film Australia
